Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Pestle
Description: This object shows a rounded surface and a flat surface. One of the extremities is rounded whereas the other has a  sharp edge along its largest width. The flat surface bears the stone's wear marks as a result of contact during grinding or smoothing actions. On the sharp edge of the object, several percussion marks can be seen, thus suggesting the possible use of the pestle as an axe.
